meanings.definition: A woman who mediates or intercedes in a dispute.
meanings.sent1: The mediatrix helped the two friends resolve their argument peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The mediatrix was able to bring the conflicting parties to a compromise.
meanings.sent3: The mediatrix cleverly convinced the siblings to share the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor made her the mediatrix of the family, always resolving conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The mediatrix's kind words had a soothing effect on the heated discussion.

meanings.definition: A person who acts as an intermediary or go-between.
meanings.sent1: The mediatrix facilitated communication between the two groups.
meanings.sent2: As a mediatrix, she was skilled at bridging the gap between different parties.
meanings.sent3: The mediatrix playfully passed notes between the students in class.
meanings.sent4: In the negotiation, he played the role of a mediatrix, ensuring both sides were heard.
meanings.sent5: Her role as a mediatrix made her indispensable in resolving conflicts peacefully.

meanings.sent1: She proudly embraced her identity as a mediatrix in the mediation process.
meanings.sent2: The mediatrix brought a unique perspective to the negotiation table.
meanings.sent3: The mediatrix's elegant attire added a touch of grace to the meeting.
meanings.sent4: In her role as a mediatrix, she embodied empathy and understanding.
meanings.sent5: Her reputation as a skilled mediatrix spread throughout the community.
